name: Lyt-js
tagline: Simple JS library with commonly used functions witten in Native JavaScript
body:
# Available Functions : *** ## lyt.find(selector, selectorType, parentReference, index) **Will find and return the html element from DOM** ###selector Mandatory field. value should be paased as string and it can be name of Class/Id/TagName/Name or a css-query selector. ###selectorType Mandatory field. what kind of selector is passed. Possible values and return types. **'id':** when element is to found by using id. will return the element with id passed in selector. **'class':** when element is to found by using class. will return array of all the elements with class passed in selector. **'tag/tagname':** when element is to found by using html-tag. will return array of all the elements with tag passed in selector. **'name':**when element is to found by using name. will return element with name passed in selector. emptystring('')/undefined:**pass '' or leave this field undefined when css-query is passed in selector. Will return array of all the elements with css-query passed in selector. ###parentReference Optional field. if not passed search will be made in entire document. else reference of and element can be passed within which search will be performed ###index Optional field. In case of class/tag/css-query, return type is an array. Pass an integer value to directly get the element instead of array. **example:** `
1 2 3
3` var ref = lyt.find('main-container','id'); // will return reference of "main-container" var ref = lyt.find('inner-content','class'); // will return array of elements with class name "inner-content" var ref = lyt.find('span','tag'); // will return array of all the spans var ref = lyt.find('username','name'); // will return reference of input with name='username' var parentRef = lyt.find('main-container','id'); var ref = lyt.find('inner-content','class', parentRef ); // will return array of elements with class name "inner-content" within the "main-container" i.e only 1, 2 and 3 var ref = lyt.find('inner-content','class', parentRef, 1 ); // will return reference of second element with class name "inner-content" within the "main-container" .
